10066374,s2,T4,T15,The search for the amino acid sequence(s) in ,Hsp90, involved in interaction with the human ,GR, has been carried out by mutational deletion analysis in whole cells, studying the effects of interaction on the nucleocytoplasmic distributions of transiently expressed Hsp90 and GR derivatives in COS-7 cells.",Complex_formation

10066374,s2,T5,T16,"The search for the amino acid sequence(s) in Hsp90 involved in interaction with the human GR has been carried out by mutational deletion analysis in whole cells, studying the effects of interaction on the nucleocytoplasmic distributions of transiently expressed ",Hsp90, and ,GR, derivatives in COS-7 cells.,Complex_formation

10066374,s3,T6,T17,"Using a recently developed confocal microscopic immunofluorescence method that allows quantification of the nucleocytoplasmic ratios of the proteins in individual cells and statistical comparison of cell populations, two subregions of the ",Hsp90, molecule have been defined that allow interaction with ,GR, (residues 206-291 and 446-581).,Complex_formation
10066374,s4,T18,T7,"The latter region may play a fundamental role in the interaction, while the former may merely stabilize the binding to ",GR, of the intact ,Hsp90, molecule.,Complex_formation
